data.title: Thoroughbred Stallion at Spendthrift Farm, KY
data.meta_description: 2020 Horse of the Year by Into Mischief
data.meta_site_name: Spendthrift - A Kentucky Thoroughbred Stallion Farm
data.text:
“The quality of stock that he’s putting on the ground is a great example of what can happen with a horse of his caliber.” —Tom Ryan

2024 Racing: First-crop 2-year-olds incl. Adeera, debut MdSpWt winner at Churchill Downs & placed in the Ellis Park Debutante S.; Authentic Strike, impressive debut MdSpWt winner at Ellis Park; Truly Legit, debut MdSpWt winner at Horseshoe Indiana in North America’s first one-mile race on dirt of the year for juveniles, etc.

2024 Sales: $1,000,000 colt at OBSMAR – the top colt by a freshman sire at the sale – purchased by John Stewart’s Resolute Bloodstock after zipping 9.4 at the breeze show.

Runaway No. 1 Freshman Yearling Sire in 2023 – $286,076 Avg. – from 91 sold, incl. $900,000 colt at KEESEP, $875,000 colt at F-T Saratoga, $875,000 colt at KEESEP, 875,000 colt at KEESEP, $800,000 colt at KEESEP, $800,000 filly at KEESEP, $800,000 filly at KEESEP, $725,000 filly at F-T Saratoga, $700,000 colt at KEESEP, $700,000 colt at KEESEP, etc. Also sired the F-T July sale-topper from his first yearling at public auction.

Buyers of top-priced first-crop yearlings include:

SF Bloodstock, Starlight Racing, Madaket, Donato Lanni, Bob Baffert, China Horse Club, Qatar Racing, Spendthrift Farm, BC Stables, D. Wayne Lukas, Grandview Equine, Live Oak Plantation, Mayberry Farm, Whisper Hill Farm, L.E.B., Chuck Sonson, West Point Thoroughbreds, Donegal Racing, Alex & JoAnn Lieblong, Summer Wind, Klaravich Stable, My Racehorse, Jacob West, Robert & Lawana Low, Ben McElroy, AMO Racing, Ken McPeek, BSW/Crow, St. Elias Stables, etc.

Far and away the No. 1 Freshman Weanling Sire with his first crop in 2022 averaging $242,692 – over a hundred thousand higher than No. 2 – incl. colts up to $575,000 & fillies up to $300,000.

One of the most popular stallions in the world his first two years at stud: Covered 229 mares in 2021 (No. 1 freshman by Comparable Index – 3.06), 202 mares in 2022.

No. 1 Freshman Covering Sire of 2021 by a wide margin with a $396,481 Avg., including first in-foal mares of $725,000, $725,000, $700,000, $650,000 (sale topper), $620,000, etc.

No stallion in North America up to $125,000 fee had a higher i/f mare average in 2021 with 10 or more sold.

Runaway multiple Eclipse Award honoree in 2020 for HORSE OF THE YEAR in North America & Champion 3-Year-Old Male.

Kentucky Derby 146 winner, Breeders’ Cup Classic champion & the best horse to date by reigning five-time champion general sire INTO MISCHIEF.

“He was our number one pick from the beginning, and he proved he’s the best horse in America.” —Bob Baffert

Won the $3,000,000 KENTUCKY DERBY (G1) gate to wire in 2:00.61 – the 7th fastest Derby ever and fastest since 2001 – defeating four G1 winners incl. Tiz the Law, Honor A. P., etc.

Dominated the $6,000,000 BREEDERS’ CUP CLASSIC (G1) gate to wire by 2 ¼ lengths in 1:59.60 (NTR) – the 7th fastest Classic ever and fastest on dirt since Ghostzapper (2004) – defeating 6 G1 winners incl. champion Maximum Security, Improbable, Tiz the Law, etc.

Lowered the 84-year-old track record at Keeneland in 1:59.60, breaking American Pharoah’s mark from the 2015 Breeders’ Cup Classic.

111 Beyer & -3 ¼ Thoro-Graph — the fastest 3-year-old of 2020.

111 Beyer — the fastest son of the great Into Mischief around two turns, topping Goldencents (110 Beyer), Life Is Good (110 Beyer), Mandaloun (106 Beyer), etc.

One of only 6 three-year-olds to accomplish the feat of winning a Triple Crown race and the Breeders’ Cup Classic, joining an elite and legendary list that includes SUNDAY SILENCE, UNBRIDLED, A.P. INDY, CURLIN & AMERICAN PHAROAH.

Won $1,000,000 Haskell (G1), $400,000 San Felipe (G2), Sham (G3); runner-up in Santa Anita Derby (G1), Preakness (G1).

Retired 100% sound with earnings of $7,201,200 – ranking 31st on the all-time Thoroughbred leaders by Earnings.

Dam FLAWLESS was a TDN Rising Star.

Free of Seattle Slew/A.P. Indy/Tapit.

First crop are 2-year-olds in 2024.

“What I really like about Authentic’s page is a ghostly pattern of Ruffian: her half-brother Icecapade recurs top and bottom, while her sire Reviewer gave us the dam of Mr. Greeley.” —Chris McGrath, TDN

Into Mischief has crossed well with mares from the Fappiano line particularly through Unbridled, who appears as broodmare sire of his brilliant daughter Covfefe. There are four Into Mischief stakes winners out of mares by Unbridled’s Song, as well as graded winner Maximus Mischief out of a mare by his son, Songandaprayer, and a stakes winner out of mares by two other sons, Political Force and Rockport Harbor. Unbridled’s Song could also be brought in through Liam’s Map, Arrogate, Midshipman and Cross Traffic. The cross of Into Mischief with a mare by Empire Maker has produced Kentucky Derby winner Mandaloun, and there is a stakes winner out of a mare by Unbridled son, Saarland. Empire Maker is sire of Pioneerof the Nile and Bodemeister, and grandsire of American Pharoah, Classic Empire and Cairo Prince. A son of Into Mischief has sired a stakes winner out of a mare by Broken Vow. Out of a mare from the Cryptoclearance branch of Fappiano, Into Mischief has graded stakes winner Conquest Enforcer out of a mare by Victory Gallop, two stakes winners out of mares by Candy Ride (sire of Twirling Candy and Gun Runner) and grade one winner Doppelganger out of a mare by Quiet American (grandsire of Midnight Lute).

Into Mischief has graded winner Golden Mischief out of a mare by Mr. Prospector son, Carson City, and graded winner Gas Station Sushi out of a mare by Carson City son Five Star Day, which also suggests daughters of City Zip. Into Mischief has sired stakes winners out of daughters of Mutakddim and Bob and John (both by Seeking the Gold, also sire of Petionville and Cape Town), and graded stakes winner Miss Mischief out of a mare by Lemon Drop Kid(by Kingmambo). Overall, almost any strain of Mr. Prospector might prove positive here, but we can note that Into Mischief has also sired graded winner Bye Bye out of a mare by Smart Strike (sire of Curlin – himself now broodmare sire of two Into Mischief stakes winners – Lookin At Lucky and English Channel) also has stakes winners out of mares by Thunder Gulch and Pulling Punches (by Two Punch, also sire of Smoke Glacken). It would also be interesting to experiment with mares by Street Sense, whose granddam is half-sister to Mr. Greeley, the broodmare sire of Authentic. From another branch of the sire line stemming from Mr. Prospector’s sire, Raise a Native, that of Majestic Prince, Into Mischief has graded stakes winner Mighty Mischief out of a mare by Super Saver (by Maria’s Mon), himself sire of Runhappy.

Into Mischief has crossed well with mares from the Fappiano line particularly through Unbridled, who appears as broodmare sire of his brilliant daughter Covfefe. There are four Into Mischief stakes winners out of mares by Unbridled’s Song, as well as graded winner Maximus Mischief out of a mare by his son, Songandaprayer, and a stakes winner out of mares by two other sons, Political Force and Rockport Harbor. Unbridled’s Song could also be brought in through Liam’s Map, Arrogate, Midshipman and Cross Traffic. The cross of Into Mischief with a mare by Empire Maker has produced Kentucky Derby winner Mandaloun, and there is a stakes winner out of a mare by Unbridled son, Saarland. Empire Maker is sire of Pioneerof the Nile and Bodemeister, and grandsire of American Pharoah, Classic Empire and Cairo Prince. Into Mischief has graded winner Golden Mischief out of a mare by Mr. Prospector son, Carson City, and graded winner Gas Station Sushi out of a mare by Carson City son Five Star Day, which also suggests daughters of City Zip. Into Mischief has sired stakes winners out of daughters of Mutakddim and Bob and John (both by Seeking the Gold, also sire of Petionville and Cape Town), and graded stakes winner Miss Mischief out of a mare by Lemon Drop Kid(by Kingmambo). Overall, almost any strain of Mr. Prospector might prove positive here, but we can note that Into Mischief has also sired graded winner Bye Bye out of a mare by Smart Strike (sire of Curlin – himself now broodmare sire of two Into Mischief stakes winners – Lookin At Lucky and English Channel) also has stakes winners out of mares by Thunder Gulch and Pulling Punches (by Two Punch, also sire of Smoke Glacken). From another branch of the sire line stemming from Mr. Prospector’s sire, Raise a Native, that of Majestic Prince, Into Mischief has graded stakes winner Mighty Mischief out of a mare by Super Saver (by Maria’s Mon), himself sire of Runhappy.
